required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of an H1 Receptor Antagonist on Exercise Performance in Hypoxia
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of an H1 Receptor Antagonist on Exercise Performance in Hypoxia

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to determine whether a simple, single intervention of Cetirizine / Zyrtec® use can improve exercise performance of active individuals when acutely exposed to altitude. For this project, healthy subjects will perform steady state and progressive work rate exercise, endurance performance time trials, and repeated sprint performance time trials in the laboratory at a simulated altitude of 3000m (9900ft) after dosing with 10 mg of Cetirizine or a placebo in a repeated measures design.

detailed_description.textblock: This study seeks to determine whether a simple, single intervention of Cetirizine / Zyrtec® use can improve exercise performance of active individuals when acutely exposed to altitude. For this project, healthy subjects will perform steady state and progressive work rate exercise, endurance performance time trials, and repeated sprint performance time trials in the laboratory at a simulated altitude of 3000m (9900ft) after dosing with 10 mg of Cetirizine or a placebo in a repeated measures design. Non-invasive techniques (pulse oximetry, near-infrared spectroscopy [NIRS]) will be utilized to measure changes in arterial oxyhemoglobin saturation and skeletal muscle oxygenation at the level of the microvasculature during exercise. It is expected that after Cetirizine, blood and muscle microvascular oxygenation during heavy exercise will improve compared to placebo, ultimately improving exercise performance at altitude. Subjects will be asked to report to the laboratory on a three occasions, separated by a minimum of 48 hours and a maximum of 14 days. For each subject, all testing sessions will be performed at the same time of day. Prior to each testing session, subjects will be asked to abstain from caffeine consumption for 12 hours. Subjects will also be asked to avoid alcohol consumption for 24 hours before testing, be at least 3-hour post prandial and avoid high-intensity exercise during the 24 hours leading to the exercise testing. Finally, subjects will be asked to consume a similar diet the night before, and the morning of, Sessions 2 and 3.

primary_outcome.description: Time to complete 8km cycling time trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Histamine Concentrations at Baseline and Post-Exercise
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and immediately post-exercise, same day as pill ingestion
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma histamine concentrations (ng/mL) were determined baseline and post-exercise for each experimental condition. Baseline measures were taken immediately prior to exercise and the post-exercise measures were taken 5-10 minutes after the cessation of exercise.

arm_group.description: Subjects orally ingested 10 mg of Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft).
Subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen).
Subjects orally ingested a 10 mg Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft).

intervention.description: Exposure to a 14.3% oxygen environment simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physically active a minimum of 120 minutes a week, as determined by questionnaire
- 18-35 years of age
- Classified as low risk, based on the modified PAR-Q questionnaire, BMI, and non-smoking status
- No history of pulmonary disease and pulmonary function classified as normal, as defined by the following measurements being 80% of predicted values: forced vital capacity (FVC), forced expired volume in one second (FEV1) and FEV1/FVC, according to the American Thoracic Society standards.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current smoker
- Women who are pregnant or could possibly be pregnant
- BMI > 25 kg/m2
- A 'yes' answer to any of the 14 questions on the PAR-Q pre-participation questionnaire
- History of pulmonary disease or <80% of predicted FCV, FEV1 and/or FEV1/FVC.
- A history of renal or liver disease, due to possible interaction effect with Cetirizine
- Currently taking any prescription or over the counter medications for the treatment of allergies, or taking any of the below listed drugs known to have a moderate or higher interaction effect with Cetirizine:
isocarboxazid tranylcypromine bosutinib clobazam crizotinib daclatasvir eliglustat hyaluronidase lomitapide lurasidone ombitasvir/paritaprevir/ritonavir phenelzine ponatinib ritonavir vemurafenib

overall_official.affiliation: Indiana University School of Public Health

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited by direct email to the administrators of the Indiana University ROTC program. It was made clear that participation of cadets was voluntary in nature and was not be a requirement of ROTC duties. Active recruitment took place from 08/2017 to 03/2018.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Enrolled participants were excluded prior to arm/group assignment if they had abnormal pulmonary function, or voluntarily discontinued with study procedures after completing a graded maximal exercise test and familiarization trial of exercise performance tests on a cycle ergometer. Two subjects withdrew prior to initial group assignments.

group.title: Cetirizine/Hypoxia, Placebo/Hypoxia, Placebo/Normoxia
group.description: During the first visit, subjects orally ingested 10 mg of Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the second visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the third visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen).

group.title: Placebo/Hypoxia, Placebo/Normoxia, Cetirizine/Hypoxia
group.description: During the first visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the second visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen). For the third visit, subjects orally ingested 10 mg Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft).

group.title: Placebo/Normoxia, Cetirizine/Hypoxia, Placebo/Hypoxia
group.description: During the first visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen). For the second visit, subjects orally ingested 10 mg Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the third visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft).

group.title: Cetirizine/Hypoxia, Placebo/Normoxia, Placebo/Hypoxia
group.description: During the first visit, subjects orally ingested 10 mg Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the second visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen). For the third visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft).

group.title: Placebo/Normoxia, Placebo/Hypoxia, Cetirizine/Hypoxia
group.description: During the first visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen). For the second visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). During the third visit, subjects orally ingested 10 mg Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft).

group.title: Placebo/Hypoxia, Cetirizine/Hypoxia, Placebo/Normoxia
group.description: During the first visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the second visit, subjects orally ingested 10 mg Cetirizine 60 min before exercising in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). For the third visit, subjects orally ingested a 10 mg gelatin Placebo 60 min before exercising in a normoxic (room-air) environment (20.9% oxygen).

baseline.population: The baseline characteristics for subjects completing all three study arms (Hypoxia/Cetirizine, Hypoxia/Placebo, Normoxia/Placebo) are included.

group.title: Subjects Completing All 3 Study Arms
group.description: Completed: Hypoxia/ Cetirizine (14.3% oxygen with 10mg cetirizine), Hypoxia/ Placebo (21% oxygen with gelatin placebo), and Normoxia/Placebo (21% oxygen with gelatin placebo)

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Performance Time
outcome.description: Time to complete 8km cycling time trial
outcome.population: Subjects who completed all three interventions were included in the outcome analysis.

group.title: Cetirizine and Hypoxia
group.description: 10 mg of Cetirizine given 60 min before exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Cetirizine: Cetirizine tablet 10 mg

group.title: Placebo and Hypoxia
group.description: Placebo given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Placebo oral capsule: Gelatin placebo

group.title: Placebo and Normoxia
group.description: Placebo given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric room-air environment (21% oxygen). Placebo oral capsule: Gelatin placebo

measure.title: Performance Time
measure.description: Time to complete 8km cycling time trial
measure.population: Subjects who completed all three interventions were included in the outcome analysis.

analysis.method_desc: The overall model was adjusted for the co-variate "VO2max."

outcome.title: Plasma Histamine Concentrations at Baseline and Post-Exercise
outcome.description: Plasma histamine concentrations (ng/mL) were determined baseline and post-exercise for each experimental condition. Baseline measures were taken immediately prior to exercise and the post-exercise measures were taken 5-10 minutes after the cessation of exercise.
outcome.time_frame: baseline and immediately post-exercise, same day as pill ingestion
outcome.population: Subjects included are those who completed all three intervention visits.

group.title: Cetirizine and Hypoxia (Baseline)
group.description: 10mg Cetirizine given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Placebo oral capsule: 10 mg Cetirizine Histamine: assessed 60 min after pill ingestion, prior to exercise

group.title: Cetirizine and Hypoxia (Post-Exercise)
group.description: 10mg Cetirizine given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Placebo oral capsule: 10 mg Cetirizine Histamine: assessed 60 min after pill ingestion, 5-10 min after 8km time trial exercise

group.title: Placebo and Hypoxia (Baseline)
group.description: Placebo given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Placebo oral capsule: gelatin placebo Histamine: assessed 60 min after pill ingestion, prior to exercise

group.title: Placebo and Hypoxia (Post-Exercise)
group.description: Placebo given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Placebo oral capsule: gelatin placebo Histamine: assessed 60 min after pill ingestion, 5-10 after 8km time trial exercise

group.title: Placebo and Normoxia (Baseline)
group.description: Placebo given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric room-air environment (21% oxygen). Placebo oral capsule: gelatin placebo Histamine: assessed 60 min after pill ingestion, prior to exercise

group.title: Placebo and Normoxia (Post-Exercise)
group.description: Placebo given 60 min prior to exercise in a normobaric room-air environment (21% oxygen). Placebo oral capsule: gelatin placebo Histamine: assessed 60 min after pill ingestion, 5-10 min following 8km time trial exercise

measure.title: Plasma Histamine Concentrations at Baseline and Post-Exercise
measure.description: Plasma histamine concentrations (ng/mL) were determined baseline and post-exercise for each experimental condition. Baseline measures were taken immediately prior to exercise and the post-exercise measures were taken 5-10 minutes after the cessation of exercise.
measure.population: Subjects included are those who completed all three intervention visits.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected at the time of each intervention visit and for a period of up to one month following each intervention visit date.
reported_events.desc: The definition of adverse event and/or serious adverse event does not differ from clinicaltrials.gov definitions. All-cause mortality was monitored/assessed.

group.title: Cetirizine and Hypoxia
group.description: 10 mg of Cetirizine given 60 min before exercise in a normobaric hypoxic environment (14.3% oxygen simulating an altitude of 3,000m/9,000ft). Cetirizine: Cetirizine tablet 10 mg

event.description: Lightheadedness and fainting episode with blood draw procedure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
